nodes.bodyText: Use // instead of /* */ for comment inside code.
In general we try to avoid using the old C-style block comment, most IDEs have short-cuts for commenting out blocks of code with //.
Always use { } around the body of a if statement. It is ok to keep it on one line.
Add method to internal Pathway class to avoid use of numeric constants.
We have decided to leave the repetitive code instead of creating an interface. Change comment to explain we didn't make an interface because this is the only place it causes repetition.
Alternatively: add methods to fetch level information to the existing superclass, returning null. Override this method only on classes with level information.
Rename method to "hasPathways", which is probably clearer and avoids negation.

Add Javadoc explaining that this sets the parent station field, adds child stops to stations, and inherits coordinates as needed from parent stations. Change the name to be a noun instead of a verb (since it's a class). Seeing that this also implies a common interface, it may be a good idea to create this interface with a name like StationElement (rather than emphasizing that it is "StopLike"). This interface would have level information and parent station information.
Check if connected via pathways instead
This is not just for GTFS, it also apply to the Netex import, so the original comment is probably better.
Not specific to GTFS, it is not implemented in the NeTEx import yet, but hopefully if we add that this code will be reused without any modifications.
